description: In the semantic adapter, we can parse JSON provided in the previous exercise. In order to do that, we can assign one variable with the JsonHandler. The Json mentioned is a Json Array, so in order to parser the JSON Array, we need a list to iterate thought the elements. In this case, we can use <#list jpath.filter("$.*",location) as fragment>. The first part, jpath.filter("$.*",location), is the entire array. The fragment is the actual element of the array. In this exercise, recover the name of all elements in the JSON Array. The final json will have a small typo, but it will be solved in the following example.
user_template:
<#assign jpath=handlers("JsonHandler")>
<#assign locationsURL = "{\"url\" : \"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/main/resources/mappings-data/01%20_SIoTRx_basic_tutorial/locations.json\"}">
<#assign location=providers("URLProvider", locationsURL)>
[<#list jpath.filter("$.*",location) as fragment>
{"name" : "[=jpath.filter("$.",fragment)]"},
</#list>
]
solution_template:
<#assign jpath=handlers("JsonHandler")>
<#assign locationsURL = "{\"url\" : \"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/main/resources/mappings-data/01%20_SIoTRx_basic_tutorial/locations.json\"}">
<#assign location=providers("URLProvider", locationsURL)>
[<#list jpath.filter("$.*",location) as fragment>
{"name" : "[=jpath.filter("$.name",fragment)]"},
</#list>
]
